intro: Hieracium chalcidicum subsp. macropannosum, commonly known as the large-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its robust growth and distinctive, often hairy, dark green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
